Package jobshop.encodings

Class Schedule

  • java.lang.Object
    • jobshop.encodings.Encoding
      • jobshop.encodings.Schedule
  • public class Schedule
extends Encoding
    Direct encoding of the solution to JobShop problem. Associates every task to its start time.

    • Field Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Schedule​(Instance instance)
      Creates a new schedule for the given instance where all start times are uninitialized.

      • toString

      • asciiGantt

        public String asciiGantt()
        Returns a string containing the Gantt chart of the given schedule, in ASCII art. Each line of the Gantt chart, contains the tasks of a particular job. Each character in the output represents a fixed number of time units For each task, we indicate : - the machine on which the task must be executed - whether this task is on the critical path (task on the critical path are filled in with stars).

      • formatTask

        String formatTask​(Task t,
                  int charPerTimeUnit,
                  boolean isCritical)
        Utility function to display a set of characters representing a task in a gantt chart.
        Parameters:
        t - Task to display
        charPerTimeUnit - How many characters to represent a time unit.
        isCritical - Is the task on the critical path.
        Returns:
        Ascii representation of the task. Length is the duration * charPerTimeUnit.

      • toSchedule

        public Optional<Schedule> toSchedule()
        Description copied from class: Encoding
        Attempts to convert this solution into a schedule.
        Specified by:
        toSchedule in class Encoding
        Returns:
        A empty optional if the solution is not valid. Otherwise the optional will contain a valid schedule of the solution.
